DataElement.preferredName: Neurologic Examination Abnormal Attributtable Pharmacologic Substance Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the abnormal neurological examination was attributable to drugs.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neurologic Examination Abnormal Attribution Pharmacologic Substance
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The assessment of the functionality of the brain, spinal column, and nerves._Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm._To assign to a cause or source._Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The assessment of the functionality of the brain, spinal column, and nerves.

Concepts.definition: The assessment of the functionality of the brain, spinal column, and nerves.

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
To assign to a cause or source.

Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
